A good recommendation from the St. Clair County Health Department: Get your flu vaccination. The federal Centers for Disease Control reports that flu activity is greatly increasing around the country. Most flu activity is being caused by influenza B/Victoria viruses, which is unusual for this time of year. A/H1N1 viruses are the second most common strains.

Everyone 6 months of age and older should get a flu vaccine every year. Antibodies can take two weeks to develop and provide protection against flu. ‚ÄúContrary to comments often heard, it is impossible to get influenza from the flu vaccine. The vaccine is the best way of protecting yourself and those around you from the flu,‚Äù said Dr. Annette Mercatante, Medical Health Officer.

The St. Clair County Health Department has a variety of flu vaccines to meet everyone‚Äôs needs (while supplies last). Most insurance is accepted and flu vaccines are typically a covered benefit.

Find out more from the health department at (810) 987-1311, or www.scchealth.co or www.beattheflu.org.

This month marked the final Early On playgroup of the summer at Flames Gymnastix in Port Huron Township. Early On offers a playgroup at Flames gym periodically throughout the year. Some of the skills that children learn at Flames are following directions, wait time, and transitioning from one activity to another while in a fun interactive environment. Early On is the system of early intervention services for infants and toddlers, birth to 3, with disabilities or developmental delays, and their families. Early On offers weekly playgroups to promote cognitive, communication, social and motor skills. Early On links families with services to address developmental delays and work on strategies to increase skills that may be done in the home or within other learning environments. Early On‚Äôs Early Learning Playgroups help children learn to transition between activities, follow directions, play with others in a play based structured environment.
Learn more about the Early On program by going to the RESA web page, sccresa.org.
